title: The Jump-off Creek
author: Molly Gloss
about: An unromanticized portrait of a pioneer woman making her own way in 1890's Oregon.

title: The Golden Spruce
author: John Vaillant
about: A tree sacred to Native peoples, the white man who destroyed it, and the history of environmental pillage that defines the Pacific Northwest.

title: Sometimes a Great Notion
author: Ken Kesey
about: Considered the great Pacific Northwest Novel, a tale of jealousy and madness set against a logging labor dispute.

title: The Hotel on the Corner of Bitter and Sweet
author: Jamie Ford
about: A young Japanese-American boy experiences his first love against the backdrop of Japanese Internment.

title: Night Dogs
author: Kent Anderson
about: A Vietnam War veteran struggles to maintain his humanity as a street cop in Portland, Oregon, in this brutal yet well-written accounting of the cost of war on one man's psyche.

title: The Good Rain
author: Timothy Egan
about: A journalist retraces the path of an early white explorer of the Pacific Northwest, and gains a clearer understanding of the link between the region's history and its present.

title: Housekeeping
author: Marilynne Robinson
about: Two young and isolated sisters struggle toward adulthood under the care of their eccentric aunt.

title: The Boys in the Boat
author: Daniel James Brown
about: A group of University of Washington students compete in rowing in the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

title: The Lone Ranger and Tonto Fistfight in Heaven
author: Sherman Alexie
about: A collection of linked short stories that paint a portrait of Native life in rural Washington.

title: Stanley Park
author: Timothy Taylor
about: A disgruntled restauranteur takes revenge on an internationalized food scene by serving what he can poach locally.

title: Your Heart is a Muscle the Size of a Fist
author: Sunil Yapa
about: A highly romanticized portrait of fictional characters in the 1999 WTO protests in Seattle.

title: Of Orcas and Men
author: David Neiwert
about: An appreciation of the beauty and power of Orca whales, as well as their tenuous existence.

title: Honey in the Horn
author: H. L. Davis
about: A novel about Oregon homesteaders, this is the only Pacific Northwest novel to have won the Pulitzer Prize.

title: Atomic Frontier Days: Hanford and the American West
author: Bruce W. Hevly and John M. Findlay
about: A history of the Hanford Nuclear Site.

title: The Cold Millions
author: Jess Walter
about: A historical novel set during the labor struggle in early-1900s Washington.

title: Astoria: John Jacob Astor and Thomas Jefferson's Lost Pacific Empire: A Story of Wealth, Ambition, and Survival
author: Peter Stark
about: A history of the original founders of Astoria and their failed venture West.
